questions.question: In the editorial, which detail supports the claim that wild animals aren't pets?

choices.answer: Wild animals are too hard to buy and sell
All owners of exotics are irresponsible
The law is too strict
Wild animals are a danger to the public

questions.question: Collectors of wild animals only need a license if

choices.answer: They show the animals to the public
they keep the animals on their own property
if they have more than one rare animal

questions.question: What argument does the commentary make about exotic animals?

choices.answer: All exotic animals are born in captivity
Terry Thompson wasn't a responsible owner
Owning them should be legal if welfare is taken care of
Many exotics are in commercial facilities

questions.question: In the commentary, which detail supports the idea that dangers from exotic animals are low?

choices.answer: Only 3.25 people per year are killed by exotic animals
People have the freedom to choose what car to drive
Traffic accidents kill 125 people per day
exotic animals are different from ordinary pets

questions.question: Which of these phrases is an example of loaded language?

choices.answer: Wild animals are not pets
laws are lax
lobbied for years for stronger laws
then we need to ban kids
that an animal was not born in the wild
no animals are ever born in the wild
animals in captivity can't have babies
an animal was born to be a pet
ordinary
cool
from another part of the world
from your hometown
require something to be done
request something to be done
to not do something
to sing a song
control or direct something to a law or principle
set something free
to ignore
to dance
shopping mall for animals
a collection of animals to show to the public
a garden
a buffet

questions.question: Why do both texts mention the incident in Zanesville, Ohio?

choices.answer: They both knew Terry Thompson
they both grew up in Ohio
It was a dramatic incident that supported their arguments

questions.question: How does each writer feel about animals?

choices.answer: they care because they both want owners to be responsible
they care because both want animal welfare taken care of
all of the above
